text:
II     - Stage III     - Stage IV        - Thymic carcinomas have usually spread to other parts of the body when diagnosed.
                
                
                    Tests done to detect thymoma or thymic carcinoma are also used to stage the disease.
                    Staging is the process used to find out if cancer has spread from the thymus to other parts of the body. The findings made during surgery and the results of tests and procedures are used to determine the stage of the
